text:
Overview

Roscoe Arbuckle , also known as Fatty Arbuckle and William Goodrich , was an American film director , comedian , screenwriter , and actor . He was born on March 24, 1887, in Smith Center, Kansas , and passed away on June 29, 1933, in New York City . Arbuckle was a citizen of the United States and was active in several fields within the movie industry , including cinematography , the film industry , filmmaking and acting .

Arbuckle's birth name was Roscoe Conkling Arbuckle , and he was related to Minta Durfee . He was the director of numerous films such as 'Curses!', 'Fool's Luck', and 'Hollywood Lights'. He was awarded the Walk of Fame for his notable work in the film industry .

Throughout his career, Arbuckle was involved in various aspects of filmmaking. Ranging from directing films like 'Windy Riley Goes Hollywood' and 'One Quiet Night' to acting in them as well. He made a lasting impact on the industry and contributed to its continued evolution.
